data.title: [OS X]Code crashed when startup

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version:Version 1.13
- OS Version:OS X El Capitan 10.11.6 (15G1212)

Additional information:

1.crush error(translated by myself): It failed unexpected when reopen the window, when you last time open "Code". Do you want to reopen its window?
2.Choose yes, it flashed for a moment and shows, "Code" exits unexpected.

Steps to Reproduce:

1.unzip, run it and immediately shutdown when the window shown(i want to move app to /application folder).
2.restart Code.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: NA

|Extension|Author|Version|

|vscode-caniuse|agauniyal|0.5.0|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.4.2|

2. type some text to search in files
3. put the wrong path to include (etc. /themes/hc-main **instead of** /themes/HC-main
4. click on the searched file to open
5. if you save opened file, it saves in the new folder (in this example "hc-main")

data.title: Set Custom Defaults for all Users
data.body:
I would like to be able to override the default settings for all users on install.
My students need to have the ' "http.proxyStrictSSL": false,' set for them instead of having them do it on every login to there computers. We have a SSL inspection transparent proxy and this is the only way i have been able to get the extensions to install.

All i really want is something like vscodeinstall.exe /s /setdefaults = new defaults.json

data.title: Investigate why unit tests sometimes fail in Linux
data.body:
Unit tests fail silently every time for Linux 32 bits. They fail seldomly for Linux 64 bits. Why is that?

The agent just dies silently once it invokes Electron to run the tests.

_From @joaomoreno on June 30, 2017 8:47_

From Microsoft/vscode#22517

In the following tslint warning, the lightbulb should appear on line 264. Instead, it appears on the first line of the current selection.

data.title: Feature request: Show file paths in inactive panes
data.body:
It'd be great to have a way to show file paths in inactive editor panes. I have tabs turned off, so a lot of empty screen space is wasted in inactive tabs that aren't showing paths.

In the below screenshot the active pane showing the file's path is the on the right. My proposal is to introduce a setting to enable showing file paths in all panes regardless of focus.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1255926/27731666-9618e870-5dc0-11e7-8926-91c1fe363192.png)

data.title: Debugging from WSH and MS HTA

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

When I issue the following from the command line:

    cscript //d //x test.js

I am able to open Visual Studio and debug my script. Would it be possible to enable the same thing for VS Code?

This issue also applies within HTAs -- when I call `debugger` from within an MS HTA, I am also able to open Visual Studio.

N.B. This is done with a dialog box for Just-In-Time debugging, presenting a choice of debuggers to use. I'm not sure if VS Code can leverage this mechanism, nor if it is necessary,

data.title: TypeScript provides two identical tasks
data.body:
- create an empty folder
- open the empty folder in VS Code
- create a file test.ts
- in the terminal run 'tsc --init'
- run Tasks>Run Build Task...

The same tasks is shown twice
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/172399/27731493-6760d73c-5d8d-11e7-84b4-5e4fa187beed.png)


After running the build task once, then the next time only a single task is proposed:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/172399/27731516-820e1590-5d8d-11e7-978b-f8652dd2b203.png)

data.title: Remove task name check in debug service
data.body: Remove name check from debugService:856 in runPrelaunchTask

data.title: [Feature Request] Drag & droping a folder/file onto the integrated terminal

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Right now it's possible to drag and drop a folder from the explorer/finder onto the VSCode window: it will attempt to open the folder into VSCode.

It would be great if the user dropped a folder onto the integrated terminal, the path would be copied into the terminal instead of opening the folder into VSCode.

data.title: [Terminal] Windows: drag and droping a tab from the workspace returns an invalid path

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: Insider
- OS Version: Windows 10 64 bit

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Drag and drop a tab from the editor onto the integrated terminal

What happens?

A unix-like path is copied, like: `/e:/docs/Dev/test.js`. This path is invalid and cannot be used into the terminal without replacing the slashes with backslashes and removing the first slash.

What should happen?

This should copy a Windows path: `e:\docs\Dev\test.js`

data.title: Multi root: search in folder no longer allows to provide file types
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. have a multi root setup
2. right click on a folder to search in that folder
3. add a file extension to the end (e.g. *.ts)
4. search

=> no results found

data.title: Multi root: Cannot search specific file types anymore
data.body:
Extracted from https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29760

* Open VS Code with multiple roots (say `vscode` and `vscode-docs`)
* Right click on `src` folder in `vscode`
* Choose Find in Folder
* append `/**/*.ts` to the file include value - `/Users/alex/src/vscode/src/**/*.ts`
* Search for a term which is there in some `*.ts` file in `src` folder
* Expected to see the matches.. But no matches are found

data.title: Starting Debug with a preLauch task referenced from an npm script fails when launching the second time
data.body: - clone vscode-eslint - change to eslint-server - npm install - npm compile - change to ../eslint - npm install - open code - change the tasks.json to: ``` { // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558 // for the documentation about the tasks.json format "version": "2.0.0", "tasks": [ { "type": "npm", "script": "watch", "isBackground": true, "problemMatcher": [ "$tsc-watch" ], "group": { "kind": "build", "isDefault": true } } ] } ``` - press F5 - Observer: everything is happy - stop debugging - press F5 - you get

data.title: Should vs/workbench/parts/views move into vs/workbench?
data.body:
I noticed that e.g. file views have a dependency to `vs/workbench/parts/views`. It seems to me that those base classes for views should be put into the base workbench land (e.g. `vs/workbench/common/view` and `vs/workbench/browser/view`) if there is a chance of reuse across workbench parts. 

I would typically try to keep dependencies between `vs/workbench/parts` as minimum as possible so that one can be taken out without impacting the other.

data.title: Task shouldn't propose a problem matcher for test tasks.
data.body:
- Mark a task as a test task (group property)
- Run that task

Ensure that no problem matcher is proposed.

data.title: c++ lldb debugger seems hangs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:13:05.928Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.5|
|vscode-clang|mitaki28|0.2.2|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.12.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I'm debugging [tensorflow](github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/) source code,at first I use bazel command 
```
bazel run  -c opt -c dbg --strip=never //tensorflow/cc/example:example 
```
to compile the source normally and then I use vs to debug.My launch.json is 

```json
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "(lldb) Launch",
            "type": "cppdbg",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/bazel-out/darwin_x86_64-dbg/bin/tensorflow/cc/example/example",
            "args": [],
            "stopAtEntry": false,
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "environment": [],
            "externalConsole": true,
            "MIMode": "lldb"
        }
    ]
}
```

at first, the debugger works fine, but when I set a breakpoint at  405 in tensorflow/core/common_runtime/direct_session.cc ,the debugger seems hangs, I can't run to next line or step out.

I've tried to debug the program with lldb in terminal with  command 

```bash
lldb bazel-out/darwin_x86_64-dbg/bin/tensorflow/cc/example/example
```

everything works normally.

data.title: Provide global setting to specify folder with workspace configuration if .vscode doesn't exist in workspace folder

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1

Hi, 
when developing for SharePoint I often need to open folder directly from SharePoint document library and work with the files there. I would like to have customized workspace and settings for this but as filenames starting with . are not allowed in SharePoint document libraries I can't copy the .vscode folder there. So I would love to have a global setting to tell Code to check for workspace configuration in a defined folder of the workspace if .vscode doesn't exist in the opened folder..

data.title: Visual Studio code consumes 39% battery on Windows 10

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|expresssnippet|vladmrnv|0.1.0|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.4.1|;


I am writing a MEAN project involving Express, Node, MongoDB, Angular. VS code seems to be taking 39% battery which is very high in my opinion. Also adding an imgur link to show the battery consumption on my Windows 10 http://imgur.com/a/DVCVr
Don't know if its an extension issue or not but i'm worried. I also turned off the blinking cursor due to a previous issue. Is there something that can be done to prevent this as i LOVE this editor and don't want to go back to that bland sublime?
![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27642991/27727223-2c10df02-5d9b-11e7-9133-158b89fa0537.JPG)


Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code and install the mentioned extensions.
2. Start writing some node code and check battery consumption.

data.title: Column/vertical select work like Visual Studio
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Arch Linux

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Perform a column select near the end of a line, or across empty lines
2. Notice that the column is broken wherever there is empty space.
3. Also notice that when interacting with a column made from individual cursors, cursor movement across line-endings cause the cursors to become all messed up.

Basically, I just want column select to work like Visual Studio. The current implementation via many-cursors is a mess.

data.title: Action to show and navigate to running tasks
data.body: There should be an action that allows a user to see the running tasks, to pick a task and to open the corresponding terminal.

data.title: Set `emmet.useNewSetting` to `false` by default in 1.14
data.body:
Currently in the Insiders we have `emmet.useNewEmmet` set to `true` by default.

Once the branch for release/1.14 is cut, this should be set to `false` in the release branch.

Creating this issue to track this, as I will be on vacation next week

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/709211c2abfa7769431940e4f294bb4629076389/src/vs/workbench/parts/emmet/electron-browser/emmet.contribution.ts#L65
